title: American Top_40_1974_April_27th
description:
"The biggest hits in the USA from the charts of Billboard Magazine. I'm Casey Kasem and the countdown rolls on."


American Top 40 with Casey Kasem aired on radio from July 4, 1970 until August 6, 1988. This recording is a rebroadcast from internet radio.

In this countdown:

There is a song by the band whose leader named it after his astrological chart.

Joni Mitchell has her song "Help Me" at number 29. Casey reads lyrics from other songs she wrote: including this:

"Rows and flows of angel hair, and ice cream castles in the air, and feather canyons everywhere."

A listener heard Casey say Charlie Rich's song, "The Most Beautiful Girl" was the only song in the last five years to hit number one on the pop and country charts. He asks if that has ever happened with different artists but the same song. Casey says yes, to three different songs in the 50's.

The youngest pupil Julliard ever had (age 6) is at number 18, Marvin Hamlisch with "The Entertainer." It is from "The Sting" soundtrack and "Tubular Bells" (at number 12 by Mike Oldfield) is from "The Exorcist," a picture Mr.Oldfeild still hadn't seen according to Casey.

Three Dog Night is at number 13 with their song "The Show Must Go On." Casey tells the curious origin of that phrase.

There is a hit by a family group who has been singing together for twenty-two years, and waited the first twenty-one of those years for their first number one single.
